attributes.action: Weddings to go ahead during 2nd lockdown, make the same rules as funerals.
attributes.additional_details: Weddings may have been planned for months or already pushed back. A lot of places only allow 1 movement of date for free so people moving the date again will have to pay a fee. Plans have been made with the people getting married and the people attending which all now need to be rearranged. Again, if funerals can continue why can’t weddings?
attributes.background: Allow weddings to go ahead during November 2020 with maximum of 30 people as per the guidelines on funerals. You previously allowed weddings to go ahead with more people than at a funeral so why is this time different?

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Permit weddings of 5 people (registrar/couple/2 witnesses) during COVID19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/315627

Allow wedding ceremonies and receptions to take place with social distancing: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/329363

Extend the limit for weddings to 30 with COVID 19 restrictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552039
